Keywords: Brute , Soldier
Real Name: John Walker
Special Powers
I'M BACK!: U.S. Agent may start the game with the Disney+ #s003 U.S. Agent's Shield and/or Disney+ #s001 Super-Soldier Serum equipped. He may have both of these equipped at the same time.
CONSISTENTLY MAKE THE RIGHT DECISIONS IN THE HEAT OF BATTLE: When a friendly character within line of fire is KO'd by an opposing effect, choose one to use for the rest of the game: Flurry, Exploit Weakness, Super Senses, Battle Fury, Outwit.
IT'S THE SAME...BUT BLACK!: Charge, Stealth. When U.S. Agent uses Charge, if he occupies hindering terrain, do not halve his speed.
COPY THAT: Combat Reflexes, Toughness, Willpower.
Trade U.S. Agent Want U.S. Agent

January 27, 2023
Skeleman
A good choice for legacy card Chief to add to Doom Patrol.
June 13, 2022
Oathful
I wish I could cheat this guy onto Shield teams with the Prime Captain Carter, but sadly we cannot. Besides that, you get an incredible amount of power for his point cost, with that power rising the longer he can stay in the game. The one thing keeping this guy balanced is his lack of range and his inherent squishiness, although the top dial Stealth does help circumvent that a bit. Bringing cheap Smokecloud and cheating him onto a Spider-Man Family team (Spider-Man 1776) or Shield team (Steve Rogers) does wonders for this figure. Thematic: 5/10 Viability: 7.5/10 Fun Factor: 8/10, fairly balanced figure
June 6, 2022
BLsquared
I see this soldier teaming up with Ares in the future...
June 1, 2022
Bobcat2022
If they could give MCU Zemo the Masters of Evil KW they coulda given MCU USAgent the KW for Thunderbolts, he shouldn't have Super Strength (literally the only Super Strength in the set), and I'm just generally not a fan of the character or how whiplash-quick they did his face turn in the finale. But yeah, super-Charge and super-Combat Reflexes make a potent combo with Stealth in game terms.

They mean don't halve his speed for Charge.
May 10, 2022
jra_fritid
Why the "IT'S THE SAME...BUT BLACK!: Charge, Stealth. When U.S. Agent uses Charge, if he occupies hindering terrain, do not halve his speed". Hindering terrain does not affect movement anymore. In the recent Empyre Rulebook it states: "HINDERING. Hindering terrain makes it more difficult to target opposing characters, like thick trees, small obstacles. Movement: Not affected. Line of Fire: If a line of fire would be drawn through any hindered terrain to a target of an attack, that target gains +1 defense for this attack. Is the old Hindering terrain effect coming back?
May 4, 2022
Goop
This guy is just NUTS for 50pts, a lot of powers and great stats. Biggest problem is his limited keywords. If not for that he would see play EVERYWHERE.
April 6, 2022
heyodern
So the shield is giving him a +3 Combat Reflexes, and the Serum gives him a 4-up willpower. If he sees a couple teammates going down, he can grab an object and charge out 10 squares, attacking with a 12/5 with EW, then flurry for a 12/4 follow-up, then sit with a 21 defense. And if he's making a 50/50 roll every turn to eat a token off, what's the probability that he's taking an action every single turn of the game?
